    "( [ eqappendixconservativeevolution ] ) shows that a given point moves in the direction perpendicular to the gradient of @xmath83 at a rate proportional to the magnitude of the gradient , and hence the energy @xmath83 is conserved along any given trajectory .    assuming a limit cycle exists",
    ", there will exist a trajectory approaching the limit cycle which is not the limit cycle .",
    "for each point in the limit cycle @xmath343 there exists an infinite sequence of points @xmath344 that approach @xmath343 which are the intersection of a curve which intersects no trajectory tangentially ( a _ transversal _ , see @xcite ) and the trajectory approaching the limit cycle . as the energy @xmath83 is continuous , we have @xmath345 , and therefore the energy of the approaching trajectory must be the same as the energy of the limit cycle .",
    "further , as energy is conserved along the trajectory , and all the points @xmath344 lie on a trajectory , @xmath346 for _ all _ points @xmath344 .",
    "thus the derivative of @xmath83 in the direction of the transversal is zero as @xmath347 .",
    "it is already known that the derivative of the energy is zero parallel to the limit cycle as energy is conserved along any trajectory . as the direction of the transversal and the limit cycle at @xmath343 are linearly independent ( a transversal intersects no trajectory tangentially ) and the manifold is two - dimensional , the gradient of @xmath83 at @xmath343 must necessarily be zero . from ( [ eqappendixconservativeevolution ] ) this implies that @xmath343 is a fixed point , which is a contradiction with @xmath343 being part of a limit cycle .",
    "our original assumption that a limit cycle exists is therefore false .",
    "it now remains to show that no trajectories approach fixed points ( with the exception of the fixed points themselves ) .",
    "as the possibility of limit cycles has been excluded , the generalised poincar - bendixson theorem shows that all remaining trajectories are periodic .    to analyse the stability of the fixed points , it is first necessary to determine their location",
    ". it immediately follows from ( [ eqappendixevolutionofanglestheta ] ) that fixed points will satisfy @xmath348 , i.e. fixed points are restricted to the great circle in the @xmath349@xmath350 plane .",
    "to parameterise this circle by a single coordinate , we alter the usual ranges of the spherical polar coordinates such that @xmath351 and @xmath352 . with this definition @xmath353 over the entire circle , instead of @xmath354 over opposite halves .",
    "the stability of ( [ eqappendixevolutionofangles ] ) about the fixed points may be used to demonstrate that there are no trajectories that approach the fixed points ( with the exception of the fixed points themselves ) . linearizing ( [ eqappendixevolutionofangles ] ) about the fixed points yields @xmath357 where @xmath358 and @xmath359 are the deviations from the fixed point and the identity has been used to simplify the result .",
    "the eigenvalues of this linear system of differential equations are @xmath360 which are pure imaginary as both @xmath70 and @xmath2 are real .",
    "this implies that there exist no trajectories near any fixed points of the system that asymptotically approach the fixed point .",
    "it may then be concluded that with the exception of the fixed points themselves , all trajectories of the system ( [ eqappendixopticalblochequations ] ) are periodic , and floquet s theorem may be applied in section  [ secinstabilitiesandexcitations ] .",

    "( springer - verlag , berlin , 1994 ) .",
    "e. g. m. van kempen , s. j. j. m. f. kokkelmans , d. j. heinzen , and b. j. verhaar , phys .",
    "* 88 * , 093201 ( 2002 ) .",
    "a. widera , f. gerbier , s. flling , t. gericke , o. mandel , and i. bloch , n. j. phys .",
    "* 8 * , 152 ( 2006 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we present a theoretical analysis of a coupled , two - state bose - einstein condensate with non - equal scattering lengths , and show that dynamical instabilities can be excited . </S>",
    "<S> we demonstrate that these instabilities are exponentially amplified resulting in highly - directional , oppositely - propagating , coherent matter beams at specific momenta . to accomplish this we prove that the mean field of our system is periodic , and extend the standard bogoliubov approach to consider a time - dependent , but cyclic , background . </S>",
    "<S> this allows us to use floquet s theorem to gain analytic insight into such systems , rather than employing the usual bogoliubov - de gennes approach , which is usually limited to numerical solutions . </S>",
    "<S> we apply our theory to the metastable helium atom laser experiment of dall _ et al . </S>",
    "<S> _  [ phys .  rev .  </S>",
    "<S> a * 79 * , 011601(r ) ( 2009 ) ] and show it explains the anomalous beam profiles they observed . </S>",
    "<S> finally we demonstrate the paired particle beams will be epr - entangled on formation . </S>"
  ]
}
